results.description:
While founders focus on critical decision points, they often end up overlooking one of the most important areas of the venture's development: Startups-legal matters.

Join me as i pick the brains of Louis Liu,Leading New York corporate lawyer as we discuss the various legal issues that need to be addressed by the founders and startups at an early stage like structuring of the company's initial capitalization, issuance of founder stock, vesting and acceleration for founder stock, election of the company's board and officers, and seed capital. 

Agenda

6:30 - Welcome note & Networking.

6:45 - Introduction

7:00 - Q&A with Louis Liu

7:45 - Audience interaction & Query session

8:00 - Networking over Beer & Snacks

Topics for discussion

1)  When do you need to form a company?
(2)  What are the benefits of formally form a company?
(3)  The differences between LLC, LP, C-Corporation, S-Corporation and what is the right type of entity for you?
(4)  What are the proper procedures to set up a company?
(5)  What if we have done a lot of work already before forming the company?  
(6) What are the key issues that should be addressed in the legal documents to ensure that the team will work well together toward a common goal?
(7)  What are the mechanics to deal with team members who do not perform or leave without good reason?
(8)  How do you find the appropriate lawyers for your company's legal need?

About Louis Liu;

General corporate lawyer, has advised start-up companies, strategic buyers to private equity funds to consummate billions of dollars of venture capital/private equity investments, mergers & acquisitions and commercial lending. he now runs his own law firm (www.liubusinesslaw.com) mostly advising start-up companies for their equities and/or grocery money.

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/zhiping-louis-liu/3b/a41/975
results.name: Startups legal-Matters; Roundtable Discussion & Networking

results.description:
Join Goodnik, Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on "The Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?" as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR. 

There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

Drinks and snacks will be provided!

RSVP at the NYCSR Meetup page

Purchase ticket at bit.ly/BSCFoCSR

Meetup members receive 50% off tickets with the discount code "CSRNY50."

SCHEDULE 
6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in 
7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A 
8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS 
Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman 
David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR 
Vera Oziransky, Project Manager, The Vitality Institute 
Laura James, HR Manager, UPS 
Marcos Salazar (Moderator), Co-Founder & Executive Director, Be Social Change
results.name: Partner Event: The Future of CSR

Each session is led by two of The North Face pro trainers and is attended by goal oriented local athletes. FREE and open to all levels. Don't miss out! bit.ly/thurs_ma_nyc

results.description:
This route is a 5K that goes through the streets of Ridgewood and Midland Park. We meet at Ridgewood Coffee Company and hit the streets! Thanks to Bob for the route and thanks to Licinio for the name.

****Please wear reflective clothing, a reflective vest, and/or some kind of light if possible.  It's essential that we are visible to vehicles.


We meet outside Ridgewood Coffee Company, just across from the big clock in Ridgewood at the intersection of E. Ridgewood Ave. and Oak St. Ridgewood Coffee Company is right up the street from where we usually start when we start at the Duck Pond. There are benches outside if you feel like sitting down and there's coffee inside if you're sleepy. This is a fun route: it starts off in downtown Ridgewood, then it goes underground, below the train tracks, then it's back on the streets and the steady incline begins and persists for a bit. After that, it gets a lot easier. Just be ready for the incline. If you don't like hills, the incline will be a nice little challenge as it only lasts for less than half a mile. It's a good route as there are only a couple of situations where traffic can hold you up. Most of the run is on sidewalks.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the corner on the sidewalk.
results.name: Bob's Run (aka Hitting the Streets of Ridgewood)

results.description:
While founders focus on critical decision points, they often end up overlooking one of the most important areas of the venture's development: Startups-legal matters.

Join me as i pick the brains of Louis Liu,Leading New York corporate lawyer as we discuss the various legal issues that need to be addressed by the founders and startups at an early stage like structuring of the company's initial capitalization, issuance of founder stock, vesting and acceleration for founder stock, election of the company's board and officers, and seed capital. 

Agenda

6:30 - Welcome note & Networking.

6:45 - Introduction

7:00 - Q&A with Louis Liu

7:45 - Audience interaction & Query session

8:00 - Networking over Beer & Snacks

Topics for discussion

1)  When do you need to form a company?
(2)  What are the benefits of formally form a company?
(3)  The differences between LLC, LP, C-Corporation, S-Corporation and what is the right type of entity for you?
(4)  What are the proper procedures to set up a company?
(5)  What if we have done a lot of work already before forming the company?  
(6) What are the key issues that should be addressed in the legal documents to ensure that the team will work well together toward a common goal?
(7)  What are the mechanics to deal with team members who do not perform or leave without good reason?
(8)  How do you find the appropriate lawyers for your company's legal need?

About Louis Liu;

General corporate lawyer, has advised start-up companies, strategic buyers to private equity funds to consummate billions of dollars of venture capital/private equity investments, mergers & acquisitions and commercial lending. he now runs his own law firm (www.liubusinesslaw.com) mostly advising start-up companies for their equities and/or grocery money.

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/zhiping-louis-liu/3b/a41/975

results.description:
A Hypnotic & Vortex Healing® Journey

1st Thursday of each month (date may vary)

6:30 – 8:30 PM (ending time may vary)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER


$35-regular price

$30-early bird (available until 1 week before event)

Please join us this evening to experience a fusion of 2 powerful  modalities -

•  Guided Meditation & Hypnosis

•  And VortexHealing®: Divine Energy Therapy

and how they can help you, and enjoy how wonderfully and synergistically they work together.

Do You Want to Learn More About Hypnosis, Energywork, Vortex Healing® or Spirituality?

Do You Have Something that is Troubling You, You Want Something Different from the Way Your Life is Going Right Now?

Are you stuck, uncertain, confused, frustrated or something else? You’re not sure if it’s emotional, energetic, mental or spiritual.

Come join Joel & Simon, and

• Let go of old thoughts, habits and beliefs

• Release blocked karma and energy

• Open gateways of mind and spirit

• Remove limitations

• Set new, more powerful intentions

• Heal old emotional issues

and begin to achieve your most heartfelt desires.

First timers, Experienced Journeyers, Come, Participate, Explore & Transform!

Give yourself this gift of healing and change


Experience Simon & Joel working together:

Joel will guide you into trance. Relaxing your mind and body, connecting you to your unconscious. Let his positive suggestions help you go deeper in trance, feel yourself become more receptive to Simon’s healing energies, divine consciousness and support healthy, ecological, appropriate change. As your trance deepens, imagine habits changing, limiting beliefs dissolving, new insights and subtle, rich, wonderful transformations occurring.

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.
Imagine feeling  new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. In each round, Simon and Joel work together. Joel guides the meditation with words, creating trance. And Simon channels the Vortex Healing® energies.

Each round, words, energies and trance will blend together, taking deeper into mind, body, energy and soul to create more profound effects. Who is this class for? This class is for anyone who is curious about experiencing hypnosis, energy work and wants to make change in their life. What’s required for this class? Just bring yourself, an openness to new experience and the possibility of change.

=================================

For more go here or try the links below to answer more questions:

Joel Elfman’s website and Hypnosis & NLP FAQs

Simon Deacon’s website and more info about Vortex Healing

=============================

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER


$35-regular price

$30-early bird (available until 1 week before event)

=============================================================

Come share this journey, and experience these 2 amazing modalities, hypnosis and Vortex Healing blending together to help your unique goals and needs.

We look forward to seeing you. Joel & Simon

------------------------------------------

Joel Elfman is Hypnotist, NLP trainer and bodyworker with over 15 years of experience. He helps transform old issues such as stress reduction, social anxiety/confidence and weight loss. Change and create new habits and beliefs for life.

For more about Joel visit his website, www.joelelfman.com

Contact info:  (646)[masked], [masked]

------------------------------------------------

Simon Deacon is a certified Merlin’s Grace Vortex Healer®. Merlin’s Grace certification is the most powerful level of Vortex Healing® you can be on. And Simon is one of only 200 people in the world whom currently hold this certification. He has a healing practice in the West Village and has been practicing for 11 years.

Contact Info:

[masked], [masked] www.simondeacon.com

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER


$35-regular price

$30-early bird (available until 1 week before event)

=============================

results.description:
Join us for our next Latin America Tech Meetup; Its theme will be joining a startup incubator, its process and benefits. 

  We will have a panel discussion with special guests from incubators and accelerators. The goal of the Latin America Tech Meetup is to connect the tech ecosystems of Latin America with the US and vice versa.

Lisa Besserman (StartupBuenosAires, Founder & CEO) - StartupBuenosAires SUBA, a community organization aimed to inspire, connect and support startups and entrepreneurship in Latin America. SUBA provides tools & resources to cultivate a strong and sustainable startup ecosystem in Buenos Aires. Lisa, has been named as Business Insider’s “Top 100 Most Influential Women in Tech” as well as the “Business Innovator of Latin America” by the Council of the Americas.

Fernando Fabre  (President - Endeavor Global) - Fernando is the current president of Endeavor Global. Immediately prior, he was the Managing Director of Endeavor Mexico since 2004. He currently serves on the board of the National Committee of Innovation which oversees a US$5 billion budget of the Mexican government on innovation;In 2003 the magazine Lideres Mexicanos called him a “Leader of the Future”; in 2005 Fortuna called him the “top entrepreneur supporter in Mexico”; and in 2007 Expansion called him one of the “30 under 30” Mexican leaders. 

Andrew Ackerman (Director, DreamIt Ventures) - Andrew Ackerman runs DreamIt Ventures New York accelerator program. One of the top 10 accelerators in the world with offices in New York, Philly, Austin, Baltimore, & Tel Aviv. Dreamit has helped launch over 200 startups (including Seatgeak, LevelUp, Meerkat, Adaptly, Elevate, etc.) who have collectively raised over $275M and who are worth in aggregate ~$1B. Ackerman began his career as a consultant to Fortune 100 companies and quickly turned his attention to tech when he worked for Kaplan Online. 

OUR HOSTS

Felipe Saenz, Felipe is the Founder & CEO of a startup to book musicians, co-organizer to Latam Tech and consultant to The Fourhundred magazine. The music startup is a platform to book musicians and for them, or their manager, to handle bookings.

Mario Valdez, born in Venezuela,and now based in NYC. Mario is the founder of a starup that deals with nutrition and fitness called traineat", and co-organizer to Latam Tech. He is also a former director of a television channel in venezuela now closed by the current regime. Mario is Lawyer and communication manager.

Special thanks to our proud sponsors:                      

 Amazon Web Services (AWS), a collection of remote computing services, also called web services, make up a cloud-computing platform offered by Amazon.com. These services operate from 11 geographical regions across the world. The most central and well-known of these services arguably include Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and Amazon S3. Amazon markets these products as a service to provide large computing-capacity more quickly and more cheaply than a client company building an actual physical server farm.

San Francisco's Regional Center (SFRC), an organization dedicated to helping individuals and families understand how to obtain EB-5 visas. But just as important, our EB-5 approach is focused on stable, job generation projects that selectively qualify our investors for the ultimate results they seek – a permanent green card. We specialize in healthcare and call center projects to date that are based on secure, U.S.-approved projects that protect and deliver results for our investors.


Training. Technology. Translation.

T3 Training is a Manhattan based Training and Executive Coaching company that partners with VCs and Start-Ups to maximize investment and minimize risk, turning Start-Ups into Sustainable Investments. They focus on the development of Post Series A, Tech Start-Ups in the advertising, digital media and digital enterprise space. To schedule a get together with T3 Training email [masked] or call <a>[masked]</a>

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qR2prZm2hVc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRX0w3Sw_8Y
results.how_to_find_us: https://latamtechmeetup.splashthat.com
results.name: Joining a Startup Incubator @AWS NYC Loft

results.description:
Events are intended for people who identify as women, which includes trans women. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc.

Host: 

Fullstack Academy of Code

Fullstack Academy is a 13-week web development immersive program based in NY. We're thrilled to host WomenWhoCode events because we're passionate about making tech inclusive! Check out our program and consider applying - WomenWhoCode member's save $2k on tuition through two unique scholarships designated to help women in tech. 

Description:

Spooky Halloween Chimes for a Haunted House!

With Halloween around the corner it's time to invoke all spooky spirits and what better way to do that than by building a quirky hardware project. In this workshop we will build several prototypes of musical chimes each one more scary than the other. 

Example Videos: 

Flower chimes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-iFNLQLxQc

Electric wind chimes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gQoL5-CF7r4 


Materials provided:

• 5 bare touch conductive boards

• 2 makeymakey

• 1 arduino

• 1 tube of conductive thread

• 2 5-packages of alligator cables

• flowers

• aluminium foil

What you should bring: 

• Your computer with Arduino IDE installed and Baretouch Conductive Board drivers installed (follow instructions here: http://www.bareconductive.com/make/setting-up-arduino-with-your-touch-board/) 

• Headphones and/or little speakers (if you have any) 

• More materials for chimes (felt, bells, LEDs, anything else you can think of) 

What you can keep: the chimes you made

What you cannot keep: the boards provided

This workshop is free of charge, however, we really encourage you to bring more materials for chimes and to set-up Arduino on your computer to make the most out if it! 

Teacher: 

Stefania Druga

Innately curious and passionate about creating and testing new learning models, instructional designer by training, evolved into a learning architect. Stefania is also a former Googler and graduated from an international Erasmus Mundus master of Media Engineering for Education (France, Spain, Portugal). In the summer of 2012 she was also the Education Teaching Fellow at Singularity University where she advised and coached 80 students from 36 countries. Currently, she is leading Hackidemia organization (mobile lab for maker Education present in 40 countries), Afrimakers (community of Maker projects in 10 Africa countries) and MakerCamp (global camps for learning how to build and run makerspaces) Stefania is also an an ambassador for global MakerFaire in Berlin and Shenzhen and is preparing a new kit for maker education in schools. Currently she is a Flatiron School fellow and NYU visiting scholar and she is always looking for creative ways to combine hardware and software with art, music and design. 

Schedule: 

6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
6:45 Welcome from Women Who Code and Fullstack 
7:00 Workshop begins 
9:15 Demo and enjoy your final prototype!

A valid photo ID will be required to enter the building. Please be sure to enter your full name when RSVPing for this event. 

Why is this event closed? RSVPs open 2 weeks in advance to ensure a higher attendance rate. So if the event is on October 15, you can start registering for it October 1.

results.description:
Happy Monday, we have 3 new free spaces for our outdoor workshop. Please only RSVP if you are certain you can make the event. Please cancel as soon as know you cannot make it to free up your place. Thank you! 

FIELD TRIP NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY: OCT 15, THURSDAY 6:30 PM-9:30 PM
This photography workshop starts at our facilities by reviewing the foundations of exposure as related uniquely to night photography. Students will test shoot all learned concepts and then head out to shoot a series of experimental key night images that will take their skills to the next level. This photo tour follows with plenty of shooting from ambiance, through motion blur to lighting effects and wonderful cityscapes. Class times are assigned so to capture part of dusk, weather permitting. Shooting areas will be Union Square park or the Highline (when possible). PhotoManhattan will provide Tripods as needed. Class is limited to 10 students. 

Requirements: basic knowledge of Manual exposure. And camera with Manual control of shutter-speed and aperture. 

NOTE: In case of rain, sessions will be rescheduled. We'l offer you the next available class thereafter.

See you there!

View other workshops or classes and Columbus day deal at: http://www.photomanhattan.com/photography-workshops-nyc-s/1896.htm

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.
results.how_to_find_us: Typically look for us on the second floor or the presence of paper!

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Mystic Path by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 12: Mystical Quietude.

You can download the book free here!

About the Book

Former Rosicrucian Grand Master Andrea discusses subjects of particular importance to all people traveling on the mystical path. This informative and inspirational work will guide you across the threshold of mystical initiation. The author provides insights into the states of consciousness and experiences you may have as you travel the mystic path. It is filled with the fire and paths of the initiate’s quest. His spiritual, mental, and physical crises are fully described and pondered. Andrea’s deep understanding of the essence of Western mystical and transcendental thought makes this a book you will treasure and refer to often as you advance in your mystical studies. Among the many topics addressed are: Meditation, Contemplation, Awakening Consciousness, the Dark Night of the Soul, Mystical Participation, and Mystical Union.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - The Mystic Path: Mystical Quietude

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Sign up at the front desk and they will direct you to the yoga room
results.name: Free Yoga Class in Manhattan

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
We are thrilled to welcome back DALIEN, aka 13 HANDS for another Yoga and Sound Meditation Workshop at Welcome Ohm, this time focusing on the Solar Plexus Chakra. After a discussion and yoga for the solar plexus, DALIEN will be musically taking you into a nada yoga, dream like state with a 40 plus minute savasana with gongs, crystal bowls, hang drum, native flutes and other ambient percussion to assist you in relieving tension, entering a dream like state (samadhi) and will help integrate the entire experience.


To follow, light acoustic guitar will gently waken the body up from the savasana into a few really fun, interactive chants to integrate and ground the experience before you go home!

All levels of yoga experience or non-experience welcome.

Please bring a yoga mat and water. Cost is $35 and pre-registration/payment is required to RSVP and hold your space. Please paypal Sarah at [masked]. Thank you! See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: We are in the same building as Healing Hands Chiropractic, parking in back. If parking lot is full, you can park across the street in the Wells Fargo Bank lot.
results.name: Solar Plexus Chakra Yoga & Sound Meditation with DALIEN, aka 13 HANDS

Everyone had a good time, so we're doing it again.

And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good

Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

A “prompt” is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!

results.description:
This month, Todd has suggested we go to his favorite, Casual Thai, a cozy and authentically decorated restaurant on Tenth and Washington. Casual Thai offers a wide range of selections, including traditional noodle-based dishes, flavorful hot curries, chef's specials, vegetarian entrees, soups, salads, and delectable appetizers. Prices range from $12 to $18 for entrees and from $5 to $8 for appetizers.

Check out the menu here: www.casual-thai.com

Casual Thai does not have a liquor license, but is BYOB, so you are welcome to bring your own wine or beer, which may be purchased at nearby Yash Wines and Liquors (1004 Washington St.).

Thanks, Todd, for being our host at what's sure to be an enjoyable  outing. Looking forward to seeing "regulars" and newcomers alike.

Note: If you RSVP "Yes," please have the courtesy to update your RSVP if you find you can't attend. We need an accurate count of people when making the reservation for this event.

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

Payment can be made in class. 


There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table and I will get to Panera Bread around 6:00 pm or before to ensure we have a table for our group.
results.how_to_find_us: Panera is near the corner of 33rd Street & 5th Ave. Closest subway is the F at 34th Street. Walk one block to 5th Ave. Turn right & walk down one block to 33rd. Street. We will be in the Cafe downstairs.
results.name: Welcome All Tarot Enthusiasts

Agenda 7pm Start:

1) Pizza and networking.

2) Erik Kamp:

Why you need to start testing your apps today including some example libraries for Android. 

3) Nick Landry:

A quick run though of Visual Studio Emulator for Android.

4) Closing:

Microsoft had some big news on their Oct 6th announcement, lets get an expert recap and have a group discussion on it.

If you're a MMAD NJ regular, this is a great opportunity to come make some new friends. MobileDevNJ members are welcome to join MMAD NJ, but note that you do not need to RSVP twice as we will merge the RSVP lists.

results.description:
Abstract:

In this talk we try to show that neural networks are a useful tool for predicting price changes on the international currency markets. We hope this will highlight the potential of neural networks to solve a large set of the data challenges faced by financial institutions. Specifically we’ll show how we applied recurrent neural networks (RNNs) with long short-term memory (LSTM) using a regularization technique called “dropout” to financial data. We extend work done by Zaremba, Sutskever, and Vinyals in Recurrent Neural Network Regularization.

Speaker Bio:


Stephen Piron is a sometimes-vegetarian, a mediocre computer programmer and life-long friend to the self-starting geek. 

About DeepLearni.ng

DeepLearni.ng is a Toronto based fintech startup who believe that artificial intelligence can solve the toughest problems faced by financial institutions. They aim to be the ‘anti-bank’ --- a company where the best and brightest feel comfortable to be technically creative. More info can be found at DeepLearni.ng .
results.name: Using Deep Neural Networks To Predict Foreign Exchange Prices

results.description:
6:00 - 6:45 - register with security, mingle, drink & eat

6:45 - 7:00 - Haifeng Li - Transactional Big Data

7:00 - 8:00 - Rohit Jain - Apache Trafodion: Enterprise-Class Transactional SQL-on-Hadoop DBMS 

8:00 ~ 8:45  - Networking 

Hadoop has been very successful for analytics. But Doug Cutting, the Hadoop creator, predicted that, in the future, organizations will run all sorts of workloads on their Hadoop clusters, even online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads. Although Apache HBase and Apache Phoenix provide high throughput, low latency, random access on big data, developers struggle with the lack of ACID transactions. Trafodion is a world class Transactional SQL RDBMS running on HBase/Hadoop, currently in Apache incubation. In this talk we will discuss the characteristic of operational workloads, the operational use cases Trafodion addresses, and why Trafodion is the right solution for these use cases. In particular, we go in depth of what is the recipe for a world class database engine, and how Trafodion implements the ingredients that make up that recipe such as world class query optimizer, parallel data flow execution engine, distributed transaction management system, performance, scale, availability, and future directions, etc.


Speaker:
Rohit Jain is the CTO at Esgyn for Trafodion, a transactional SQL-on-HBase RDBMS. Rohit worked for Hewlett-Packard for 28 of his 39 years on applications and databases, as solutions architect, consultant, software engineer, architect, development and QA manager, Product Manager, and Chief Technologist, for Online Transaction Processing, Operational Data Stores, Data Marts, Enterprise Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence, and Advanced Analytics, on distributed massively parallel systems.
results.name: Transactions on Hadoop/HBase - Beer, Wine & Pizza

results.description:
Love, Fire and Transformation
Evening with Jeannie Zandi

Thursday, October 15, 7-9 pm

Clinton Cameo Studios

307 W. 43rd Street

New York City

</a>

Sliding scale: $15-20  No one turned away for lack of funds

Contact: Arlene [masked] or[masked]

Join Jeannie and friends for an exploration into the potent depth of what's often overlooked in the moment: Being.  Jeannie's gift for inviting people to join her in resting and rooted presence evokes a deep meeting with oneself and reality.  Within that, Jeannie's humor and iconoclasm serve to bring people into an understanding that is beyond the intellectual.  Through silent and guided meditation, spontaneous talks and exchange with participants, Jeannie will host a space of clarity and warmth where the true richness of life can be experienced, and your innermost spiritual questions can be met fully.  Come join us!

Jeannie Zandi is the director of Living as Love, a nonprofit organization dedicated to seeding a culture of the Heart on the planet, inspiring, teaching and supporting people to live from their essence as Love.  A year before the birth of her daughter, Jeannie was plunged into a dark night of the soul that culminated in a radical shift of consciousness. She is known for her fearless clarity, tender mercy toward humanness, and a juicy, poetic and often humorous style that draws from Advaita Vedanta, Sufism, Christian mysticism and the ongoing revelation of fully engaged living. Residing in Colorado, she travels widely in the US and Canada, bringing a down-to-earth embodied teaching of living as love.

<a href="http://www.jeanniezandi.com">www.jeanniezandi.com

https://www.facebook.com/Living.as.Love
results.name: Evening with Jeannie Zandi - Thur., Oct. 15, 2015 (7-9 pm)

results.description:
The New York City Sea Gypsies 

Present

“Ghost Ships of the Great Lakes”  

By Becky Kagan Schott

Description:

For hundreds of years ships have used the Great Lakes and for hundreds of years ships have collided with other ships in fog, burned in fires, storms or just vanished. The ships range from schooners to freighters and most of them sit on the lake bottom in the cold, fresh water just frozen in time. The names of the ships can still been seen on some of the wooden hulls, rigging on the masts that are still standing 70ft tall, and dozens of artifacts to be seen on each wreck. The lakes offer something for everyone from snorkeling to technical diving and each wreck has a story to tell. 

About the Speaker:

Becky Schott is a multiple Emmy Award-winning underwater cameraman, photographer, and accomplished technical diver whose work can be seen on major networks including National Geographic, Discovery Channel, and the Travel Channel. She is co-owner of Liquid Productions, Inc, specializing in capturing quality imagery in challenging environments. Her projects have taken her all over the globe from exploring virgin wrecks in over 300 feet of water in the Great Lakes, rappelling into caves in the jungle, filming under ice in the Arctic to diving cage-less with great white sharks.

Becky is extremely passionate about sharing the underwater world with others both through her imagery or teaching someone to dive. She's been teaching scuba since 2000 and is an active technical diving instructor and TDI Rebreather Instructor. In her spare time she’s participated in several exploration projects around the world that have earned her a place as a Fellow in the Explorers Club and in 2013 she was inducted into the Women Divers Hall of Fame.

www.LiquidProductions.com  /  www.MegDiver.com

****  Note:  The official  Club Annual  Meeting  as per our bylaws, where  club  where elections will take place,  will be held in  November  *****
results.how_to_find_us: Second Floor - use backstairs
results.name: Reminder -Oct. Meeting:  “Ghost Ships of the Great Lakes” by Becky Kagan Schott

results.description:
This is an open invitation for those who might be interested in learning more about Grandmother Ceremonies in the Colombian tradition being practiced in the NY area. This information session encompasses the understanding of this tradition, protocols, preparations and risks, why is it used back in the jungle and why is coming out of this sacred space into our cities.

Taita Fredy grew up around the medicine, he comes from Mallama, Nariño, a región south west of Colombia, between the Pacific and the Amazon jungle in this area he’s experienced the medicine in different traditions, learning as an apprentice and helper for Elders from the Siona, Inga, Kamentzá, Yanacona and Awá communities, For the last 15 years he’s been working with the medicine himself and developing his own ceremony based on all he’s learned. In the present Fredy has found himself traveling around the world, sharing his ceremony, his medicine and his heart with people from different cultures and backgrounds, this as he believes, is part of his mission in this life to take this knowledge and healing to those who need it.

Fredy is a humble man who doesn’t believe in one only truth, he keeps his heart open to all believes, and bases his work in the concepts of love and freedom. There is no obligation, no dependence, and no commitment to a group or believe, just respect.

During the two-hour sessions, Fredy will share not only information but also his gift as a sound healer, interpreting melodies that he uses to guide the Singing Meditation Ceremonies.
results.name: Ancestral Journey Information Session

results.description:
Please note the venue change.

Join Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on "The Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?" as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR.


There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

Drinks and snacks will be provided!

Sign up now at bit.ly/BSCFoCSR

Meetup members receive 50% off tickets with the discount code "CSRNY50."

SCHEDULE
6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in
7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A
8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS
Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman
David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR
Vera Oziransky, Project Manager, The Vitality Institute
Laura James, HR Manager, UPS
Marcos Salazar (Moderator), Co-Founder & Executive Director, Be Social Change
results.name: The Future of CSR: Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?

group.name: The New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup Group

Hey Everyone!

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Fall and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code NYCMUFALL15 . I've already created a team for our group called Here for the Beer - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/5501-Here-for-the-Beer

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! If Sundays don’t work for you there is a Monday night option as well! We have a team with the same name in that league you can join! 


This is the info on the meetup below! We get $10 off with the promo code, but the meetup ends soon!!

</a>

<a href="http://www.betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg">

Better Off Bowling, New York‘s Biggest Social Bowling League! 

Hundreds of fun young professionals (20's and 30's), co-ed and non-competitive, and at only $79 (with discount code) for the entire season, incredibly affordable!

Includes:

results.description:
Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble

Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. 

SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.name: Join our Christmas Blues Rock ensemble!

results.description:
I'll be bringing a review of a Charles Williams book from the New Yorker Magazine to share.   Charles Williams was one of the lesser known Inklings.

Williams' interest in mystical topics, he was initiated into a spinoff of the Golden Dawn,  makes his works interesting for this time of year.  Celtic folklore says the Season of Samhain (Halloween) is when the veil between the worlds is thin and we can see into another dimension.  A good time of to take a look at Williams' work. "..By the way, this Golden Dawn has no connection to the Greek political party and included such notables as nobel prize laureate W. B. Yeats and opera singer Florence Farr.
results.name: An Inkling for Magic-Charles Williams Friends of Tolkien & Fantasy Meetup

results.description:
In The Mirror of Death: An Introduction to the Tibetan Buddhist Understanding of Death and Dying

This 8-week course guides participants through the essential teachings on dying and death from the Buddhist tradition of Tibet. It offers a glimpse of this practical wisdom and sacred inspiration, which is so beneficial for today’s world. The universal message of these teachings speaks to people from all walks of life and is relevant for those of any spiritual tradition or none. They show us how we can face uncertainty and change, transform difficulty and fear, prepare for death and support others to die with dignity.

The course is open to everyone. However, registration is limited to 15 people.

Some books you may find helpful for the course:

The Tibetan Book of Living and Dying by Sogyal Rinpoche

Facing Death and Finding Hope by Christine Longaker

Eight Thursday evenings: September 24 – November 19 (no class on October 22)

7:00PM – 9:00PM

Course Fee:$125.00

Please register at

https://crm.usa.rigpa.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=149
results.name: In The Mirror of Death (8 week course @ Rigpa)

results.description:
NEW MONTHLY SERIES ‘INDIA’S NEW WAVE’ CELEBRATING CONTEMPORARY INDIAN CINEMA LAUNCHES THIS THURSDAY! 


India produces more films annually than any other country, and there is a wide variety of work in numerous languages. Museum of the Moving Image will present a new monthly series, India’s New Wave, to showcase this work by some of the most exciting voices in contemporary Indian cinema today. 


The series opens THIS THURSDAY, October 15 @ 7PM, with Bombay Velvet, a brilliant ode to American gangster films with 1960s jazz-era Bombay as the backdrop. The film is co-edited by Martin Scorsese’s long-time collaborator Thelma Schoonmaker; directed by Anurag Kashyap, one of the pioneers of India’s independent cinema; and features Ranbir Kapoor and the music of Amit Trivedi.

"BOMBAY VELVET" October 15 @ 7PM

Tickets: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students)

Use code INDIASNEWAVELAUNCH for 20% off admission. 

Seating is limited so reserve your ticket in advance TODAY.

More info + Tickets: http://www.movingimage.us/india

See you there!


Geoffrey
results.name: Movie Night: Bombay Velvet

results.description:
For just $25 you can taste 8 modestly priced Bordeaux wines, a white, 6 reds & a desert wine with assorted cheeses. These wines are all drinkable now & cost less than $15/bottle. 

Our hosts for the evening, Camille Suspene & Clemence Vizier, represent Univitas, the largest exporter of Bordeaux wines. 

                                                 Camille Suspene:  


                                                   Clemence Vizier:

Both Camille & Clemence speak fluent English & French, while Clemence also speaks Swedish.  So, if you are looking for the perfect menu to pair with both Bordeaux wines & Akvavit, it is a certainty that Clemence will oblige!  All kidding aside, these two globe-trotting Bordeaux wine marketeers have worked in a range of exotic & familiar markets, such Arvert, Bordeaux & Lyons, France, Montreal, Canada, Chicago, Cleveland, New Jersey, New York & Philadelphia! So, I am sure they will bring their very valuable & unusual experiences to bear on our appreciation of these wines and the region of Bordeaux.


Please join us for a casual wine tasting of Bordeaux wines that are accessible to both palate & wallet.

While various cheese and breads will  be served, you may wish to order appetizers or a full dinner, There are several fine restaurants nearby that deliver. Here is a partial list:

Frank’s Pizza, Monica's Italian Restaurant, Selenita Mexican Restaurant, Taqueria la Juquilita Mexican Restaurant, Hing Lee Chinese Restaurant, & Khao Tip Thai Restaurant.

Menus will be available.

All wines presented by Camille & Clemence will be available for sale.

Here’s the line-up…

Mayne Sansac Grand Vin de Bordeaux Blanc 2014 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com       

50% Sauvignon, 25% Muscadelle, 25% Sémillon, an elegant & refined Bordeaux with a floral & fruity bouquet, its first impression of clean, dry freshness becoming rich & soft in the mouth. This wine is ideal served at 10°/11°C with fish & white meats, or simply enjoy it on its own.

Terroir

Mayne Sansac vineyard is located in a clay-limestone terroir. This type of soil joins the freshness of the clay and the filtering properties of the limestone.

Vinification & Aging

Grapes are harvested when they have reached a perfect maturity. Then on one side, the Sauvignon blanc grapes are macerated with enzymes in a stainless steel tank while Semillion and Muscadelle grapes are pressed to obtain juice; Once mixed together, the fermentation lasts about 6 months in the tank at 20°C in order to preserve all the aromas: the Sauvignon grapes give the wine its concentrated spicy aroma; the well ripened Semillon grapes its richness and roundness.

Mayne Sansac Grand Vin de Bordeaux Rouge 2010 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com       

50% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc… this is a distinguished Bordeaux with a well-balanced structure enhancing a complex bouquet of red fruits. First impression of supple tannins is followed by a long & velvety aftertaste - a Bordeaux red with a touch of aristocracy. Can last up to 4 or 5 years to gain maturity & best served at 15° / 16° C accompanied by all types of meat & cheese.

Terroir

Mayne Sansac vineyard is located in a clay-limestone terroir. This type of soil joins the freshness of the clay and the filtering properties of the limestone which is a perfect suit for the Merlot vine. Wines that come from this type of terroir are generally round with few tannins & lovely fruity notes.

Vinification & Aging

Univitis’ winemakers use the traditional Bordeaux vinification techniques. Indeed, the grapes are harvested at perfect maturity & vinified with selected yeasts & temperature controlled. Average fermentation 8 to 10 days. This wine is ready for drinking but can be stored up to 5 years. It has all the elegance & finesse of the best wines from the most famous vineyards in the world.

Château Bayerette 2012   

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

60% Merlot & 40% Cabernet Sauvignon… the good balance of grape varieties produce the structured red Bordeaux that with time, age well. Best served at 16ºC accompanied by traditional gastronomic food with cheese.

Soil: Clay and calcareous ground.

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphenol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Surface: The vineyards of Chateau Bayerette has been dedicated to the tradition of vine cultivations for more than 120 years.

Production: 500 HL

Château Pierre Plantée 2011   

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

65% Merlot & 35% Cabernet Sauvignon… Rich & luscious with a fragrance of red fruits, a velvety satin texture & hints of cherry & black current on the palate. Full in flavor, supple with very gentle tannins in the mouth & with a soft lingering finish. Great by itself, with red meats or soft cheeses.

Soil: Clay and limestone.

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphénol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine- making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing. The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Surface: The vineyard around 10 HA of ChâteauPierre Plantée is located in the region of Castillon la Bataille.

Production: 250 HL

Château la Mondette 2010 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com     

“Commended” - Decanter World Wine Awards

82% Merlot & 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine is dark ruby red in color. It has rich aromas of prune, leather & underbrush. Your palette explodes with flavors of ripe red berries. Château La Mondette is a fruity, rich, full, and with much complexity. Tannins are young but very supple in the finish just beg you for another sip, and then another! This wine would pair best with savory garlic marinated steaks, with a baked beef stew or herbed lamb chops. Or try just to sip this wine with some very sharp white cheddar cheese, and a handful of ripe red skinned grapes!

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphénol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine-making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing.

Aging: Half aged in stainless steel vats, half in French oak barrels.

Soil: Boulbènes on clay and sandy soils. Nathalie Valentuzzi und Xavier Aubry own this property of 4.5 Hectares since several years in a small village Salle de Castillon not far from Bordeaux.

Surface: The vineyard of Chateau Les Paris covers 10 hectares around Sainte-Foy.

Production: 100 HL

Château Clovis Grand Vin de Bordeaux 2011 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com     

78% Merlot & 22% Cabernet Sauvignon makes the Château Clovis a delicious red wine with a dark red color, nice fragrance of ripe red fruits and smooth and gentle in taste. Delicious to drink now but will show more complexity in the coming years. Best Served at Best at 17° 18°. This wine accompanies perfectly red meat, cheeses.

Vinification: The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Soil: Clay and sandy clay and limestone

Surface: The 5 hectars Vineyards of Château Clovis are situated in the beautiful hills of the Dordogne Valley.

Production: 250 HL

Château Les Paris 2011 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com  

Top 100 Bordeaux Wines in the USA – Today’s Bordeaux 2014

Sainte-Foy-Bordeaux is an appellation on the eastern edge of the Bordeaux wine region in France. It produces dry wines, both red & white, of average quality. It is arguable that Sainte-Foy-Bordeaux is more properly part of the Bergerac region rather than Bordeaux – it is located outside the natural eastern boundary of Bordeaux rdgion, and just a few miles west of Bergerac.

46% Merlot, 41% Cabernet Sauvignon & 13% Cabernet Franc… Deep crimson with ruby tints. The nose is lively & generous with aromas of red fruit & liquorice. Structured & rounded on the palate with a long finish revealing lovely mature tannins, mild & silky. Just the wine to be laid down in a cellar for two or three years to reach its best. Perfect with meat in sauce, game & cheeses.

Vinification: The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Half aged in stainless steel vats, half in French oak barrels.

Soil: Clay and limestone.

Surface: The vineyard of Château Les Paris covers 10 hectares around Sainte-Foy

Production: 100 HL

Domaine de la Guillonie Monbazillac 2012 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

97% Semillon, 2% Muscadelle, 1% Sauvignon, Monbazillac is a discreet pale gold colored wine. It has a bouquet with notes of dried fruit and acacia. Well balanced on the palate and full flavored in the mouth.

Vinification: Separated and traced vinification, cold racking of the must, careful selection over ripened grapes, temperature controlled fermentation (18°C).

Aging: In stainless steel. Storage in temperature-controlled cellars before commercialization.

Soil: Clay and Limestone

Surface: A discreet pale gold colored wine. It has a bouquet with notes of dried fruit and acacia. Well balanced on the palate and full flavored in the mouth.
results.name: Taste 8 Bordeaux Wines @ Amazing Grapes in Pompton Lakes, Only $25!

results.description:
In love we find out who we want to be.
In war we find out who we are.

FRANCE, 1939

In the quiet village of Carriveau, Vianne Mauriac says goodbye to her husband, Antoine, as he heads for the Front. She doesn't believe that the Nazis will invade France...but invade they do, in droves of marching soldiers, in caravans of trucks and tanks, in planes that fill the skies and drop bombs upon the innocent. When a German captain requisitions Vianne's home, she and her daughter must live with the enemy or lose everything. Without food or money or hope, as danger escalates all around them, she is forced to make one impossible choice after another to keep her family alive.

Vianne's sister, Isabelle, is a rebellious eighteen-year-old girl, searching for purpose with all the reckless passion of youth. While thousands of Parisians march into the unknown terrors of war, she meets Gäetan, a partisan who believes the French can fight the Nazis from within France, and she falls in love as only the young can...completely. But when he betrays her, Isabelle joins the Resistance and never looks back, risking her life time and again to save others.

With courage, grace and powerful insight, bestselling author Kristin Hannah captures the epic panorama of WWII and illuminates an intimate part of history seldom seen: the women's war. The Nightingale tells the stories of two sisters, separated by years and experience, by ideals, passion and circumstance, each embarking on her own dangerous path toward survival, love, and freedom in German-occupied, war-torn France--a heartbreakingly beautiful novel that celebrates the resilience of the human spirit and the durability of women. It is a novel for everyone, a novel for a lifetime.
results.name: The Nightingale by Kristen Hannah

results.description:
ArtsTech returns to Projective Space this month with a discussion on the artist as entrepreneur, sponsored by Monegraph. While the familiarity of galleries and other traditional models is sufficient for the sale and distribution of some artwork, there is much left to be desired for artists. 

Monegraph CEO Kevin McCoy will offer a first-hand demo and his insights on building Monegraph, a platform for media rights management. Our extraordinary panelists include the writer Mike Pepi, gallerist Kelani Nichole, artist Martha Hipley, alt-consultancy group K-HOLE, and moderator Raj Udeshi of Emerging Collective, all of whom are looking to dive into the following guiding questions:


-What are other models or disruptions that we're seeing today-- either an individual artist or an organization -- that are bucking the traditional approach? 

-How is success defined for an artist? If measured by revenue—do we weigh the total figure that goes to the studio or to individual artworks? 

-Why do we look to the startup model for artists? How do we characterize the definition of a startup?

**We encourage attendees to Monegraph their work--additionally, any monegraphed work has a chance to be featured in the $25,000 #thisismymonegraph campaign for future advertising campaigns.***

Schedule:

7:00pm – Doors and Monegraph open demo

7:30-8:30pm – Panel Discussion

8:30-9:30pm – Conversation continues over drinks & snacks

Speakers:

Mike Pepi writes about aesthetics, theory, and criticism. His work has appeared in frieze, e-flux, Flash Art, Art in America, DIS Magazine, The Straddler, The New Inquiry, Artwrit, The Art Newspaper, this is tomorrow,艺术界 LEAP, the Apollo Magazine Blog, Big Red & Shiny, The Brooklyn Rail, Rhizome, and The New Criterion. He is a contributing editor at The Straddler, and organizes Cloud-Based Institutional Critique, a reading group focused on digital technologies and their relationship to cultural institutions.

Kelani Nichole is an independent curator and user-centered design specialist working at the intersection of art and technology. She is co-founder and director of TRANSFER Gallery, an exhibition space exploring the friction between networked studio practice and its physical instantiation.  The gallery's focus is to develop new modes of exhibition and support for artists working with computer-based practices.

Martha Hipley is an artist working in digital and paint, occasionally under the brand everyoneisugly. Her blog “tramps-l’oeil” documents her work with male fashion photography and Tumblr fandom. In addition to being awarded a Rhizome microgrant for her project “Untitled Twitter Hack,” she is also the second best web surfer in the world.

Sean Monahan (K-HOLE) is a member of K-HOLE, a trend forecasting group based in New York. K-HOLE is a future trends report that both elevates and parodies the ridiculous but inspirational vocabulary of people trying to predict the future of consumerism.

Moderator:

Raj Udeshi is co-founder of Hidden Levers, a financial technology startup company providing financial advisors and professional traders with Web-based tools to assess macro risks and stress test portfolios. Raj Udeshi is also founder of Emerging Collective, a foundation supporting activist artists from emerging markets.

Sponsor:

Monegraph is a professional licensing platform, offering a new direction for how creators of all kinds can distribute, market and sell their digital work online. Monegraph’s platform simplifies the often complex process of media licensing by pairing a template-driven interface for contract creation with a streamlined process for payment processing and media handling. It creates a simple and pervasive mechanism for publishers, advertisers and collectors to 
discover creative work and purchase it directly from the creators while offering clear and verifiable licenses and ownership history.

Conceived by Artist & CEO Kevin McCoy at the New Museum in 2014, the platform has pioneered an innovative approach to media rights management based on blockchain technology. The use of blockchain architecture allows a clear link to be established between the author of a work and its title of ownership, its constellation of usage rights, and payment terms for handling those rights.
results.name: Disruption in the Art World: Artist as Entrepreneur

results.description:
Note: Please join our newly-made chat channel


OK, so we compiled a couple of interesting questions and possible projects from the first meetup. Let's build on this.


• What can we listen to?


•  What is legal to listen to?


• How do we show the limitations of radio, both physical and legal?

• How do we build a low-cost 'node' to capture interesting information?

• Could this be an adafruit kit? Could we make learn.adafruit.com experiments for interested people?


• How do we make it easy to use and understand?

• What would a radio 'field guide' look like, like http://seeingnetworks.in/nyc/ ?

• Can we make easy-to-understand and follow antennae building guides?

We are experimenting with changing spaces all around the city, and have identified friendly ones:

School for Poetic Computation

IRL Space

NYU CUSP

NYC Resistor

Babycastles

ITP?

NYU Poly Wireless Center?

Are there other places we could work out of? Please share them!
results.name: Questions into Projects, and intro to the rtl with ShinySDR

results.description:
Are  you secretive about your money? Do you worry about money? Do you have a love-hate relationship with money?  Money is energy and a tool of exchange.  Our beliefs and behaviors, conscious and unconscious about money, influence how we experience our current financial reality.


Join Special Guest Enid Martinez and explore your unique dynamics with money by becoming aware of your money archetypes and how these influence your present money behaviors and experience.

In this presentation we will briefly discuss the money archetypes, what are they and how they effect, passively or actively, your current money experience.  These archetypes are always present regardless of socio-economics.  The great news is that these archetypes, once you are aware of them, can be utilized to your advantage as these can be your allies and help you to change your current money dynamics into one of empowerment and freedom.  Take a Money Type Quiz and find out which of your money types are more active presently.

We are indeed meant to be affluent in health, love, joy as well as financially. The main question now is, how do you truly want your money experience to be like? 

 Enid effectively guides and assists others, through practical and simple ways, to become more aware about their relationship to money and themselves.  Most importantly, she supports others from a place of compassion and  non-judgment, to make changes in their lives and money behaviors.  Compassionate awareness followed by conscious action is transformative. Enid guides others to tap into their inner resources and wisdom to actively live the lives they dream of and to experience and enjoy financial freedom.

Enid received her training and certification from The Money Coaching Institute, a coach training organization located in Northern California.  She also has a MBA in Finance from Rutgers University. 

Enid Martinez Intuitive Spiritual Counselor Intuitive Animal Communicator and Healer[masked]

www.thehearthelix.com

www.petsoulconnection.com

<a>www.affluentawareness.com.</a> 

[masked].

Join Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on the Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good? as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR.

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: bit.ly/BSCFoCSR **

=======================================

There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: bit.ly/BSCFoCSR **

=======================================

{Drinks and snacks will be provided!}

Join the conversation on Twitter:

@BeSocialChange | @MarcosSalazar | @whatifglobal | @AmanSinghCSR | @EdelmanPR | @vera_oziransky | @BSRnews | @UPS | #givelocal | @KopaliOrganics

SCHEDULE

6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in

7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A

8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS

• Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman

• David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR

• Vera Oziransky, Public Health Consultant

• Laura James, HR Manager, UPS

• Marcos Salazar (Moderator), Co-Founder & Executive Director, Be Social Change

Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman

Aman Singh is one of the first journalists to focus on CSR and sustainability issues in the mainstream media, including leading coverage for Forbes CSR blog. She is a seasoned communicator, an enthusiastic social media strategist and an avid facilitator for stakeholder engagement, working through her firm -- Singh Solutions  -on authentic and contextual CSR/sustainability reporting and communication strategies.

Before joining Edelman’s Business + Social Purpose team in New York as a Vice President, she served as CSRwire's Editorial Director, leading the media company's news distribution services, creating and growing its stakeholder engagement campaigns and CSR/sustainability reporting services with private and public sector organizations like JPMorgan Chase, Unilever, Johnson & Johnson, Campbell Soup, Nestle Waters North America, Best Buy, PwC, SAP, Verizon, Sodexo, General Mills, Aramark, and others and collaborating with its 8,000+ members on content and conversations that matter. She also led CSRwire's team of reporters with 250+ contributors while authoring numerous articles and live reports across the platform’s 25+ issue areas.

Follow Aman on Twitter: @AmanSinghCSR & @EdelmanPR

<a href="http://www.bsr.org/en/about/staff-bio/david-korngold">

<a href="http://www.bsr.org/en/about/staff-bio/david-korngold">https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/JG6rO52Cxq8wpqS3alBjUXcWZmEp287OsViZZpy4zgIM5Ws01pWhEGnPI-WpdIsEg5NlsQjcB10MEEYIGSnORqIAiT0B6yTibdJfO4xekjaTYknzAmcCShgqeCfHAEaKRtuGuu4O

David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR

David is a Manager, Advisory Services at BSR, a global nonprofit business network and consultancy dedicated to sustainability.  He works with multinational corporations to help them integrate sustainability and stakeholder perspectives into their core business strategies. Concentrating on the technology and financial services sectors, David leads initiatives with companies including AT&T, KKR, and IBM, on topics such as the environment, human rights, and inclusive economies.  Additionally, David has created and facilitated corporate trainings, written articles and research papers, and served as a panelist/speaker at international conferences hosted by organizations such as Dow Jones and the Private Equity Growth Capital Council.

In advancing corporate sustainability, David applies his prior experience as a strategy and management consultant at Bain & Company. In that role, he developed evidence-driven approaches to advise companies on issues ranging from operational organization to corporate strategy. Additionally, David has worked as an independent consultant in sustainability and nonprofit governance.

Follow BSR on Twitter: @BSCnews

Vera Oziransky, Public Health Consultant

Vera Oziransky served as the project manager at The Vitality Institute, where she led the Institute’s work on evidence-based workplace and community health promotion, focusing on a holistic approach to health, which includes both physical and mental wellbeing. Ms. Oziransky also led the Institute’s work on healthy design, promoting the co-benefits of designing for health and sustainability and co-authored the report “Beyond the Four Wall: Why Community is Critical to Workforce Health,” calling for increased cross-sector collaboration to address community-level drivers of workforce health.

Previously, Ms. Oziransky was the Senior Policy Analyst at the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene’s Office of External Affairs. She led the development of Take Care New York, the city’s five year health agenda, and provided expertise in the development of the health department’s priority policy initiatives. Prior to this role, Ms. Oziransky directed New York City’s tobacco mentoring activities for Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s Communities Putting Prevention to Work initiative, consulting with 12 health departments nationwide on tobacco control policy, media, and coalition building.

Follow Vera on Twitter: @vera_oziransky

Laura James, HR Manager, UPS

Laura is the East Region Community Relations Manager for UPS with the responsibility of managing the UPS Local Grants program for her respective territory and implementing UPS's strategy to advance the company's commitment to making local communities stronger

A 20-year UPS veteran, Laura began her career in New York City as a part-time employee in the Industrial Engineering Department and was later promoted into Industrial Engineering management upon receiving her degree in organizational management.

After a number of assignments within Industrial Engineering including roles in Package and Transportation operations, Laura then rotated into Human Resources and has held assignments within Employee Relations, Learning & Development and Workforce planning before assuming her current role.

Laura currently sits on the boards of St. Nicks Alliance, Playworks of Greater NY/NJ, and the Tri State Diversity Council.

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
A dark and thrilling tale of new friends made in a cold and chilling suburb of Sweden that is haunted by ritual killings of bodies drained of blood.                          


// Book  
 Let the Right One In, John Ajvide Lindqvist 
*Note: This book also goes by the name Let Me In.
It is autumn 1981 when the inconceivable comes to Blackeberg, a suburb in Sweden. The body of a teenage boy is found, emptied of blood, the murder rumored to be part of a ritual killing. Twelve-year-old Oskar is personally hoping that revenge has come at long last—revenge for the bullying he endures at school, day after day.

But the murder is not the most important thing on his mind. A new girl has moved in next door—a girl who has never seen a Rubik’s Cube before, but who can solve it at once. There is something wrong with her, though, something odd. And she only comes out at night....


// Location 
Acme, 9 Great Jones St. 
Join us in this dark, cavernous, candle-lit, chamber bar under the Acme restaurant. The reservation is in the downstairs lounge under the name Anastasia; we'll have tables by the bar. 
Menu available here. 


// Dues
This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!


// Book Giveaway
Book giveaway will be announced closer to Meetup date.


// Next Month
Join us next month for the AMERICAN FRONTIER. Vote here for next month's book.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll have a table by the bar, downstairs in the lounge. Reservation under Anastasia G.
results.name: Book #2 - Let the Right One In by John Ajvide Lindqvist
