3rd Hudson County Flippers and Funders Networking Event


Date: Thursday, October 15th 

Time: 7:00-10:00PM

Location: Zeppelin Hall Beirgarten, 88 Liberty View Drive, Jersey City, NJ

Schedule: Open Networking from 7-10PM

Cost: $10 (cards accepted)

RSVP:  Sign up on our group page at http://www.meetup.com/Hudson-County-Flippers-and-Funders/ or email your name and any guests to [masked]. After the event, contact information of all who attend and participate will be emailed out to everyone.

Funding For Deals

If you are in need of funding for a deal, all Flippers and Funders Events are Sponsored by Alpha Funding Solutions.  Alpha funds 80-90% of Purchase Price and 100% of Renovation Costs.  Loan sizes range from 100K to 10 Million.  If you would like to learn more about Alpha’s program, reach out to me directly at [masked].

2-Day Education Event – Wholesaling and Rehabbing

If you are interested in learning about wholesaling, rehabbing, or both, you should absolutely checkout this two-day event: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/insiders-double-decker-weekend-workshop-tickets-18811990169

For more info on what the event will be covering, checkout my interview with Rob Orfino and Glen Galucci at this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mxxrFGODI8w

If you’re looking to get started in real estate, or just sharpen your skills, this is a can’t miss event!

Professional Organizing

If you are in need of Professional Organizing Services, or Packing/Unpacking Services, reach out to us at [masked].

TV Show Casting – First Time Flippers

If you’re interested in auditioning for the TV Show First Time Flippers, email your contact information to [masked] and we will have them reach out to you. 

TV Show Casting – Calling All Experienced Couples!

Departure Films is now casting for a new television show in development. They are looking for flipping couples in the Essex County area to be the next great TV flipping team. Couples must have big personalities and have a passion for real estate. Couples must also have experience and a knowledge of real estate investing.

If this sounds like you, please email us at <a>[masked]</a>. Include a brief introduction along with a few photos of yourselves. Please also include some before and after photos of your recent project(s).

Gap Funding For Deals

If you are interested in providing gap funding for other investors’ deals, we maintain a list of gap funders to refer people to.  If you are interested in gap funding as a way to make a nice return or to learn the business, email us your contact info and how much you’re looking to invest at [masked] and we will add you to the list.

Sponsorship

If you are interested in becoming a sponsor of this event, reach out to us at [masked].

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

results.description:
In 1969, Texas Longhorns safety Freddie Steinmark played the national championship season on a left leg ravaged by osteosarcoma. Directed by Angelo Pizzo and based on Jim Dent's book "Courage Beyond the Game: The Freddie Steinmark Story," "My All American" is Steinmark's story.

What Freddie Steinmark (Finn Wittrock) wants most in the world is to play football. Deemed too small by the usual athletic standards, his father trains him hard, and Freddie brings a fight to the game that ultimately gets him noticed — by none other than legendary University of Texas coach Darrell Royal (Aaron Eckhart). Awarded a scholarship and a chance to play for the Longhorns, Freddie sets off to Austin with his loving high school sweetheart Linda (Sarah Bolger), determined to make the team. Alongside his old teammate Bobby Mitchell (Rett Terrell) and new pal James Street (Juston Street), Freddie is put through the paces of a grueling practice schedule, but the boys' camaraderie off the field translates into solid playing on it, and they rise up the depth charts, giving the Longhorns a real chance to turn around their losing record. But just when they're reveling in the success of the season, Freddie suffers an injury that leads to a shocking diagnosis and the biggest challenge he will ever face.

You must bring a ticket to the movie theater and wait on the line.  Just click on http://www.gofobo.com/MAA55he  to get a movie ticket.
results.how_to_find_us: TO GET TICKETS CLICK ON this  http://www.gofobo.com/MAA55
results.name: Free Screening of My All American movie

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Swango
October 15-17th, 7:30pm
Schimmel Center for the Arts 

Use code WEST25 for the discount price

 A new revival of the 2005 off-Broadway hit by Tony Award®-winning playwright, Rupert Holmes, based on a concept by Mariela Franganillo (of Recuerdo Tango performed at Schimmel in 2013) and Robert Royston. Following in the tradition of West Side Story, this contemporary, Romeo and Juliet story depicts a unique fusion of dance, romance, revelry and rivalry within and between two different worlds. In one evening we see the tale of two lovers; the girl from the sultry world of Argentine Tango, the boy from the lively arena of West Coast Swing. When the lovers conquer their differences, they create the harmonic fusion of Swing and Tango.

More info: http://schimmel.pace.edu/events/swango-the-theatrical-dance-experience
results.name: Discount tickets SWANGO, the theatrical dance experience !

results.description:
Mushroom Murders by by Chad Anderson (Author), Jeff Coney (Author), Rober Keough (Author), & 4 more

Delaware City was a peaceful little port town until its citizens started getting slaughtered! At the scene of each crime, all that is left is a small pile of ash and one creepy little mushroom. The police bring in two expendable detectives, Sterling Silversmith and Emerald Johnson, who are in way over their heads as they try to stop any more deaths! With ancient mysteries, demons hungering for human flesh, and an unexpected love story, the Mushroom Murders takes everything creepy and mystic about mushrooms and explodes it into an original, fast-paced, and character-driven five-issue limited series! Produced by Creator's Edge Press, written by Chad Anderson (Marvel Comics Handbook writer) and penciled by talented cartoonist Robert Keough, the Mushroom Murders is a surefire hit with surprises in store with every turn of the page!

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.
results.name: Sam's BSFW Short Story Meetup

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
George Lightcap will recount his travels on the AT at this meeting.  He will provide information about the Appalachian Trail and discuss his two big hikes in 2012 and 2013 that completed his sectional hike of the trail.  I'm sure there will be pictures.

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!
results.name: Weekly Meeting - George Lightcap AT Hike Presentation

results.description:
http://brightonasylum.com/the-tunnel

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLR_bJhB3QE

GENERAL Admission $25.00 (good for 2 attractions The Asylum & The Tunnel)


(CLICK HERE) Buy Tickets!

I strongly recommend purchasing your tickets A.S.A.P.


Based on what I've read on some blogs, looks like the Tunnel is gonna be sick! Our admission tickets include entry to both "The Tunnel" and "Asylum" attraction. I'd like to do both, but let's see how the night pans out and how long lines are. The idea here is to purchase timed tickets for 8:00pm 10/15/2015 (muy importante guys), so we can skip some of the wait time.


*IMPORTANT - The general consensus is that this walk through is very scary. So, if this isn't your thing, or you have a preexisting health condition, I would advise checking the website, and/or reviews on the interweb, for more details. 

Brighton Asylum contact info: http://brightonasylum.com/contact 

(201) 716 - 2827

I love Halloween, so let's kick this month off with a good scare. 

DESCRIPTION

Brighton Asylum is proud to present its newest attraction, THE TUNNEL. 

Descend deep under the brick and mortar of Brighton Asylum and explore the long forgotten tunnel system that once allowed its staff to move undetected beneath the grounds.

Once a brilliantly devised underground system, over time became a breeding ground for unsanctioned patient experiments, living quarters for staff gone mad, and attempted patient escapes and hiding.

Some say that the Tunnels became just as dangerous as Brighton Asylum itself, if not more so. Those brave enough to explore the forgotten tunnel system are never seen nor heard from again... - See more at: http://www.newjerseyhauntedhouses.com/halloween/night-mares-haunted-attraction-nj.html#sthash.yoa7sI0p.dpuf

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

results.description:
A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE

“But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord”

(Joshua 24:15 KJV)


Please, join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Biblical Worldview Conference Call led by Pastor and Christian Party of America National Chairman, Clell Drumheller. He will present an in-depth scriptural perspective of how Christians are to live in these challenging times and engage in civil affairs. The conference call is the third Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM. EST (7:30 PM Central). Topics will range from how to be culturally “in the world, but not of it,” to what is the Christian’s biblical response to political events. Each call will begin with a 30-minute formal presentation by Mr. Drumheller, followed by a question and answer section. For recording quality of the presentations, which will be archived, we ask that everyone, please, mute their telephones until the end of the presentation. If you arrive late to the call, please, mute your phone as you log in, so that the presentation will not be interrupted as you join us. Thank you ahead of time for your compliance. After the presentation you can unmute your phone if you would like to participate in the discussion and/or ask questions. If you would like to contact Mr. Drumheller, please do so at [masked] or call the Christian Party of America toll-free number at [masked]-3927.


Biography -- Clell M. Drumheller, II: Mr. Drumheller, a former Marine Corps Sergeant, is an ordained pastor and is the Founder/Pastor of Truth in Love Ministries in Houston, Texas. He has a Master of Divinity from Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary and a Bachelor of Arts in Christianity and English from Houston Baptist University. In 2010, Mr. Drumheller became the founding National Chairman of the Christian Party of America. Among other affiliations Mr. Drumheller is a member of the Black Robed Regiment and holds a teaching certificate through Lone Star College. He has also engaged in various professional, business, and volunteer activities. He was born in Ocala, Florida on November 20, 1951 and was saved in Houston, Texas on August 4, 1969. He and his wife Cynde reside in Houston, Texas.


The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls provide a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So, sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!


The conference call will last for about an hour but staying for the entire call is optional.  If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges required by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can, even, listen in on the conference call while at other events. Just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE-CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

Hello Friends

We are fortunate to have Mark Peter Davis of Interplay VC come and share his thoughts and wisdom.

Mark is a venture capitalist, incubator, a serial founder & investor

He's currently the founder/managing director of Interplay Ventures and a co-founder of Kohort, DevSpark, Founder Shield, Fulton Waters, Founder Shield, Nomad Financial, Truman James, TwentyPine, Varick North, Venwise and others.

Mark is also an Adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at Singularity University.

Prior, Mark was a VC at High Peaks Venture Partners and DFJ Gotham Ventures, where he invested in information companies.

As for interests, he really enjoy brainstorming new ideas, thinking about the future, tinkering with new technology, listening to rock ‘n roll, boxing, learning, documentaries and an occasional game of rock band.

While it may look like he is married to the startup scene, he is actually married to his college sweetheart Laurie and have a daughter named Avery and a son named Austin.

Folks, you don't want to miss out!! Please let your friends know and join us as we wrap up NY tech week with a bang!

Stay classy
results.name: NY Tech Week - Mark Peter Davis (Interplay VC)

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

09:50 to 10:10 Introductions

10:10 to 11:00 Current Business Methods

Most people take a few notes, so some paper would be good.

Best Regards,
Steve Navazio

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.

No fees for Newbees

results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.


In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.


This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.


Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.


There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. The paper used in this workshop has been donated by Hahnemuhule.


Here is an outline of Tony's presentation:

B&W Print Workshop

Background of presenter

How to Make a Good Digital Print


The Basics

• No image prints as you see it

• Tonal Range Adjusted in Editing

Monitors for photographers

• Calibrate Your Monitor

• Understanding Pixels and File Formats

• Pixels are Measured in Bits

• Why Does it Matter?

• Advantage of Bit Depth


Editing and Processing ICC Profiles

• Here's How to Make One

• Why Make Your Own Profiles?

Work Flow

• Adobe Camera Raw

Adobe Photoshop

venue.name: The William and Lynda Steere Herbarium

results.description:
The William and Lynda Steere Herbarium is the centerpiece of the Garden's botanical research program. It is the fourth largest herbarium in the world, and the largest in the Western Hemisphere.

The Herbarium holds a collection of more than 7.7 million preserved plant specimens that have been collected by researchers for the past 200 years. We are in the process of imaging and documenting information on these plants so that the data can be used in research applications such as evolution, biodiversity, and climate change.
results.name: Let's meet up and volunteer in the New York Botanical Garden's Herbarium!

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
Come enjoy the fall foliage and beautiful autumn scenery at AMC’s 2015 Fall Gathering on historic Lake George! This is a great opportunity to meet Young Members from the other 11 AMC chapters and to learn about AMC.

The 2015 Fall Gathering will be held October 16-18 and is being hosted by the Mohawk Hudson Chapter. Join AMC members from all chapters at Camp Chingachgook, nestled along the shore of gorgeous Lake George in the Adirondack Mountains. All AMC members and their friends are invited to enjoy this fun annual event! Activities will include hikes to the numerous peaks that surround Lake George, cycling, and paddling (bring your own kayak). Friday and Saturday evenings feature pre-dinner social hours, live music and campfires. To learn more: http://bit.ly/1QbVrej

To lodge in the Young Members cabin, please follow these instructions:
1. Go to http://bit.ly/1QbVrej
2. Click "Register now!"
3. Select “Unheated Cabin/Yurt”
4. You will receive a confirmation email from AMC
5. Reply to the confirmation email and specify that you would like to be in the Young Member cabin.
6. Please notify me at [masked]. I will coordinate carpooling arrangements.

If you have any questions, please contact Susannah Hatch at [masked].

Like us on Facebook for event updates and invites.
results.name: AMC 2015 Fall Gathering

The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.


In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.


This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.


Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.


There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. The paper used in this workshop has been donated by Hahnemuhule.


Here is an outline of Tony's presentation:

B&W Print Workshop

Background of presenter

How to Make a Good Digital Print


The Basics

• No image prints as you see it

• Tonal Range Adjusted in Editing

Monitors for photographers

• Calibrate Your Monitor

• Understanding Pixels and File Formats

• Pixels are Measured in Bits

• Why Does it Matter?

• Advantage of Bit Depth


Editing and Processing ICC Profiles

• Why use ICC Profiles?

• Here's How to Make One

• Why Make Your Own Profiles?

Work Flow

• Adobe Bridge

• Adobe Camera Raw

• Adobe Camera Raw - Define Your Space

• Adobe Camera Raw - Straighten

• Adobe Camera Raw - Lens Correction

• Adobe Camera Raw - Chromatic Aberration

• Digital Cameras Produce Noise

• Adobe Camera Raw - Sharpening & Noise Reduction


Adobe Photoshop

• Adobe Photoshop - Image Size to Print Size

• A Word About Size

• Soft Proofing Your Images

• Soft Proofing Your Images - Gamut Warning

• Adjusting Contrast to Print

• Sharpening  for Output

• 3rd Party Sharpening

• Print Dialog

• Printer Settings

• Print

Printers

• Variety of Printer Technologies

• Digital Print Technologies

• Ink-Jet Printers

• Inkjet Papers: A World of Choices!

• Let's Talk Papers

• Which InkJet Paper is Best?

• How White is Your Paper?

• What's Your Paper Made From?

• How Heavy is Your Paper?

• What Does Your Paper Feel Like?

• Key Specs to Look For

• More on Archival Paper

Post Printing InkJet Tips

Some of My Resources

WHEW!!! What a workshop. Think I'll sit in on this one myself.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for anyone wearing a orange or blue Pinnies.
results.name: Friday Afternoon Pick-up 4PM

results.description:
Taste Beer from Flying Dog Brewery!

Dogtoberfest
Gonzo Imperial Porter
Bloodline

Dogtoberfest- Brewed with 100% imported German ingredients, it will cut spice while pulling out sweetness. Flavor notes: Full-bodied caramel sweet with a light toasted and crisp, clean finish Pairs with: Mexican and Pepper Jack cheeses; sweet Asian sauces; spiced desserts; German foods.

Gonzo Imperial Porter - Gonzo is big, bold, and beautiful like the man it was brewed in honor of – Dr. Hunter S. Thompson. Flavor notes: Roasted chocolate, coffee, and vanilla malt flavors balanced with a unique hop bite Pairs with: Mushrooms; smoked meats, BBQ, and chili; hard cheese; chocolate and coffee desserts.

Bloodline - Bloodline begins with huge grapefruit on the nose. Then, a delicate balance of citrus sweetness and bitterness. Try it with grilled light proteins, salads with fruity vinaigrettes, and fresh salsa.

Brewed locally in Frederick Maryland Read more about Flying Dog Brewery at : www.flyingdogbrewery.com

Since there will be 3 beers offered, this event is best suited for those who are either interested in Flying Dog beer or who are close enough to stop by easily. Wine Chateau offers free tastings and free tapas. It's not 5-star cuisine, but it's still a generous offering as it's free. The tapas are typically the same at each event.

Stop by if you can. I plan to attend for the first hour or so.
results.how_to_find_us: The tasting lounge is at the front of the store.
results.name: Free Beer Tasting: Flying Dog Brewery & Free Tapas

results.description:
Tim Lee, Founder and CEO of ArcBit bitcoin wallet, will present to Byte Academy and a limited number of guests to help understand Bitcoin, blockchain and the overall cryptocurrency phenomena.  

ArcBit is a mobile app that gives you full control over your bitcoins enabling you to send and receive bitcoins from anywhere in the world to anywhere in the world.  

Having studied Bitcoin since its very beginnings, Tim will talk about the security of Bitcoin and the blockchain, its history, future, and applications in global economy.  He will also talk about his product and strategy.  As the prime engineer, Tim will provide an invaluable technical understanding of the blockchain.

RSVP in advance as there is a limited number of tickets.  Due to the overwhelming response, some attendees may have to stand.
results.name: Intro to Cryptocurrency & Blockchain By Tim Lee, CEO, ArcBit Bitcoin Wallet

results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.

In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.

This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.

Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.

There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. results.name: Black & White Images, The Art of Conversion - A two part workshop

results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.

In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.

This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.

Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.

There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. The paper used in this workshop has been donated by Hahnemuhule.

results.description:
Togetherness: Each of Us, All of Us.

During this retreat we will be looking at ourselves as individuals and also as part of the Universal Whole, how we move towards balance within ourselves and each other. What keeps us apart and makes us feel isolated, and what we can do to become less fractured. We'll search for those elements of our lives that we have in common.

Throughout the weekend we'll aim to integrate the parts -- chanting meditations, satsangs, discussions, fun activities and meal time -- to come together as one cohesive whole.

All this will take place at Saint Mary's Villa in Sloatsburg, New York, a spectacular setting and a short 30 minute ride from the Tappan Zee Bridge.

Cost: Full weekend in double room - $240

Full weekend in single room - $280 (limited availability)

Saturday only with lunch and dinner - $85

To register, go to americanmeditationsociety.org -- upcoming retreats -- NY Weekend Retreat -- select and add to cart. Payment processed through PayPal.

Review cancellation policy on americanmeditationsociety.org.

For additional information or questions please contact Marcia at: [masked] or phone[masked]

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
We do this party every year, but this time we're teaming up with over 50 Meetup groups to put together "the ultimate" FALL FLING!

Join 300+ singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline.  

What to expect: 

• 2 for 1 Drinks (6-7pm)

• Free Light Appetizers

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "FALL" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Oct-16-2015_at_0600PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door   

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. General age range 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Oct-16-2015_at_0600PM

results.description:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 in advance only

PRE-PAY HERE: http://4th230fifth.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Join us and over 300 other singles at one of the hottest venues in NYC! Manhattan's largest & most spectacular penthouse lounge & rooftop, the luxurious 230 Fifth is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. What to expect: Drink specials, Complimentary Appetizers, Fun Ice Breakers, DJ & Dancing, and Giveaways.

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. This event is mostly for 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. 

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

This event is for members in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

*Later that night we will make our way to Slate NYC for the after party! Admission is absolutely free! (Slate NYC, 54 W 21st street between 5th and 6th avenue)


Cheers

venue.address_1: 49 Grove St (btw Christopher St and 7th Ave)
venue.name: 49 Grove

results.description:
Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

This is *not* a typical meet-and-greet open social, this is a "Cocktails & Conversations" event with three rounds of active and challenging debates. It will be crowded, it will be edgy - you can participate in discussions or socialize in the main room.

**************************************************************

Drink Specials

Tapas Menu & Full Drink Bar Available

See you at Grove!
results.name: Cocktails & Conversations Social at 49 Grove (Free, Drink Specials, Food Menu)

Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

This is *not* a typical meet-and-greet open social, this is a "Cocktails & Conversations" event with three rounds of active and challenging debates. It will be crowded, it will be edgy - you can participate in discussions or socialize in the main room.

**************************************************************

Drink Specials

Tapas Menu & Full Drink Bar Available

See you at Grove!
results.name: Cocktails & Conversations Social at 49 Grove (Free, Drink Specials, Food Menu)

results.description:
We do this party every year, but this time we're teaming up with over 50 Meetup groups to put together "the ultimate" FALL FLING!

Join 300+ singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline.  

What to expect: 

• 2 for 1 Drinks (6-7pm)

• Free Light Appetizers

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "FALL" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Oct-16-2015_at_0600PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door   

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. General age range 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Oct-16-2015_at_0600PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for Meetup members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided at the door
results.name: 'The Ultimate' FALL FLING (2 For 1 Drinks, Comp Appetizers, DJ, Icebreakers)

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

This event is for members in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

*Later that night we will make our way to Slate NYC for the after party! Admission is absolutely free! (Slate NYC, 54 W 21st street between 5th and 6th avenue)


Cheers

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

[masked]

Date: FRIDAY OCTOBER 16, 2015

Admission: EVERYONE FREE ON RORY'S LIST

Time: 6pm- 10pm

Venue: HUDSON TERRACE (621 West 46th Street Between 11th & 12th Ave)

Dress Code: Business casual

Subway: TAKE A, C, 1, 2, 3, N,R,Q, S  TO 42ND STREET.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
